moves.1. f4: The Bird's opening. I don't encounter it very often, but I now a gambit against it: The From's gambit.
moves.1... e5: Black offers a pawns in return for rapid development and attacking chances.
moves.2. fxe5: White could've played e4 going into the king's gambit, but I would've played d5 gambiting one of my own pawns again.
moves.2... d6 3. exd6 Bxd6 4. Nf3 g5: To chase the knight away and threaten Qh4 .
moves.5. g3 g4 6. Nh4 Ne7 7. d4 Ng6 8. Nxg6 hx: I get an open h-file which I'll later use for the attack.
moves.9. Qd3: To prevent things like: 9. Nc3 Bxg3 10. hxg3 Rxh1 or 9. Bg2 Rxh2 10. Rxh2 Bxg3 .
moves.14... Bd7 15. Bf4: 15. dxe5 isn't possible because of 15. ... Bc4  16. Kh1 Rx2  17. Kxh2 Rh8  18. Bh3 Rxh3  19. Kg2 Qxe5 20. Bf4 Qh5 and white can't cope with the threats.
moves.15... Nf3+: I sacrifice another pawn to open up his kings position.
moves.16. Bxf3: If 16. Kh1 then Rxh2 and mate follows. Perhaps 16. Rxf3 was best.
moves.16... Bxf4 17. gxf4: After a bishop moves follows Be3  and black has a good attack.
moves.17... gxf3 18. Rxf3: When I saw this position on move 15, I thought I would have good chances here.
moves.18... f5: First I try to open the h1-a8 diagonal for my bishop. Best here for white would've been Nd2 I think.
moves.19. e5 Bc6 20. Rf2 Qh4: I come closer with my queen.
moves.21. Na3 Qh3: Better was 21. Be4 22. Qd2 Qg4  23. Kf1 Rh3 and blacks attack is comming through.
moves.22. Rd1: This move loses, but it was already hard to see what white could've don't against the threat Rh8-h4-g4 . Perhaps best for white was Rg2 to sacrifice the exchange, but it was just hopeless.
